list.title: RateLimitOptions
list.description: Creates a simple IP-based rate limiter.

list.title: Request
list.description: Express request.

list.title: Request
list.description: Express request.

list.title: Request
list.description: Express request.

list.title: Request
list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express request.

list.title: Request
list.description: Express request.

list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.description: Express response.

list.title: Response
list.description: Express response.

list.title: SendEmailResult
list.description: Sends a password reset email containing a reset link.

list.title: SessionUser
list.description: Checks whether a session user should be treated as admin for gallery operations.

list.title: acceptInvite
list.description:
Accepts a team invitation by token.

Enforces the single-team membership rule.

list.title: addComment
list.description: Adds a comment to a post.

list.title: addFavoriteCompetition
list.description: Add a competition to the current user's favorites (Redis set).

list.title: addLdapUser
list.description: Create a new LDAP user.

list.title: apiRequest
list.description:
Executes an API request against the configured backend.

Notes:

  • path must be an API path starting with / (e.g. /teams, /auth/login).
  • Session cookies are automatically included.
  • Throws an Error when the response is not OK.

list.title: approveJoinRequest
list.description: Approve a join request (team owner only).

list.title: approveRegistration
list.description: Approves a pending registration.

list.title: backend/controller/admin.controller.js
list.description:
Admin dashboard controllers.

This file contains both server-rendered admin pages and JSON API endpoints used by the admin dashboard (charts/stats). API routes are protected by authentication and super_admin role at the router level.

list.title: backend/controller/admin.crud.controller.js
list.description:
Generic admin CRUD controllers (server-rendered).

Used by the admin panel to render list and form pages for a small set of whitelisted models. Model configuration (fields, labels) is defined in this file.

list.title: backend/controller/admin.redis.controller.js
list.description:
Redis explorer controllers (server-rendered + JSON).

These endpoints are mounted under /admin/redis and /admin/api/redis/*.

list.title: backend/controller/auth.controller.js
list.description:
Authentication and account management handlers.

The backend uses cookie-based sessions (express-session). These handlers set/clear req.session.user.

list.title: backend/controller/competitions.controller.js
list.description:
Competition CRUD and discovery endpoints.

Includes listing/searching competitions, reading a competition (with access-based hiding of sensitive fields), admin-only CRUD, and per-user favorites stored in Redis.

list.title: backend/controller/country.controller.js
list.description:
Country CRUD endpoints.

Public read endpoints return the country list / details. Write endpoints are intended to be protected by route middleware (super_admin).

list.title: backend/controller/db.controller.js
list.description:
Sequelize database connection factory.

This project uses ESM modules and MySQL via mysql2. Tables are configured with freezeTableName: true and timestamps: false because models explicitly define created_at/updated_at fields.

list.title: backend/controller/ldap.controller.js
list.description:
Admin-only LDAP management controllers (server-rendered).

These handlers are mounted under the admin panel routes (see backend/routes/admin.route.js). They bind with the configured service account and allow listing/adding/editing/deleting users in the LDAP directory.

list.title: backend/controller/media.controller.js
list.description:
Authenticated media library endpoints.

Supports listing media (with pagination and optional uploader filter), reading a single media record, uploading a file to /uploads, and deleting media.

list.title: backend/controller/notifications.controller.js
list.description:
CRUD handlers for in-app notifications.

Notes:

  • This controller currently does not enforce auth/ownership by itself; routes must protect access.
  • Notifications are typically created by other business flows (teams, registration, etc.).

list.title: backend/controller/posts.controller.js
list.description:
API handlers for posts, likes, and comments.

Notes:

  • Some endpoints are admin-only (e.g., create/pin) and enforced at the router level.
  • This controller emits Socket.IO events (e.g. post_created, comment_added).
  • POST_CONTENT_MAX_BYTES limits post content size to prevent oversized payloads.

list.title: backend/controller/push.controller.js
list.description:
Web Push subscription and test endpoints.

Exposes the VAPID public key and authenticated endpoints to subscribe/unsubscribe push subscriptions, plus a test-send helper.

list.title: backend/controller/registration.controller.js
list.description:
API handlers for competition registrations.

Registrations are protected by session auth at the API router level. Admin actions (approve/reject/export) are further protected via requireRole('super_admin').

list.title: backend/controller/robot_file.controller.js
list.description:
Robot file upload/list/delete endpoints.

Robot files are uploaded for a team and competition and can be toggled public. Access checks are enforced for team members (or admins).

list.title: backend/controller/sponsors.controller.js
list.description:
Sponsor API handlers.

Sponsors support optional logo upload (multipart/form-data).

list.title: backend/controller/stream.controller.js
list.description:
Stream API handlers.

Streams can be associated with a competition and team. Access rules:

  • Creating/deleting streams requires authentication.
  • For competition streams, the team must be approved for that competition.
  • For non-admin viewers, stream_url is removed unless the viewer is approved.

list.title: backend/controller/system_log.controller.js
list.description:
System log querying and stats endpoints.

These endpoints are intended to be protected by route-level middleware (authentication + super_admin).

list.title: backend/controller/team_chat.controller.js
list.description:
Team chat endpoints (messages + attachments).

Provides message history for a team and allows posting messages (text and/or attachments). Messages are emitted via Socket.IO to the team_<teamId> room and create notifications for other team members.

list.title: backend/controller/team_log.controller.js
list.description:
Team log endpoints.

Team logs are internal notes/entries associated with a team and competition. Only team members (or admins) can create/read/delete entries.

list.title: backend/controller/team_members.controller.js
list.description:
Team membership CRUD endpoints.

Supports creating, listing, reading, updating, and deleting team membership records. Routes apply authentication for mutating endpoints.

list.title: backend/controller/teams.controller.js
list.description:
Team management endpoints.

Includes team CRUD, invitations (accept/decline), join requests, membership status helpers, and competition registration.

list.title: backend/controller/user.controller.js
list.description:
User API handlers.

Routes:

  • Public search: GET /api/users?q=...
  • Authenticated self endpoints: GET/PATCH/DELETE /api/users/me
  • By-id endpoints require ownership checks at the router level.

list.title: backend/middleware/auth.middleware.js
list.description: Session authentication middleware.

list.title: backend/middleware/ownership.middleware.js
list.description: Ownership enforcement middleware.

list.title: backend/middleware/rateLimit.middleware.js
list.description:
Lightweight in-memory rate limiter.

Note: This is process-local and is not shared across multiple instances. For production horizontal scaling, replace with a shared store (Redis).

list.title: backend/middleware/requestId.middleware.js
list.description: Request id middleware.

list.title: backend/middleware/role.middleware.js
list.description: Role-based access control middleware.

list.title: backend/middleware/session.middleware.js
list.description:
Session helpers for server-rendered admin pages.

Note: These middlewares are intended for the EJS admin panel (HTML redirects), not JSON APIs.

list.title: backend/middleware/upload.middleware.js
list.description:
Multer-based upload middleware.

Files are stored on disk under the project uploads/ folder. The backend typically serves these as static files from /uploads.

list.title: backend/models/index.js
list.description:
Sequelize model registry.

This module:

  • Dynamically imports all *.model.js files in this folder.
  • Instantiates each model using the shared Sequelize instance.
  • Invokes model.associate(db) when present.

Exported as a single db object containing models and the sequelize instance.

list.title: backend/models/notifications.model.js
list.description: Sequelize model definition for in-app notifications.

list.title: backend/utils/email.js
list.description: Email helpers (Resend).

list.title: backend/utils/logger.js
list.description:
Central Winston logger configuration.

Logs:

  • Rotating access logs (info)
  • Rotating error logs (error)
  • Console logs (debug)

list.title: backend/utils/realtime.js
list.description: Realtime utilities for emitting Socket.IO events and mirroring select events as Web Push.

list.title: backend/utils/redis.js
list.description:
Shared Redis client.

Used for throttling, tokens, and other ephemeral data. Connection URL is read from REDIS_URL.

list.title: backend/utils/signToken.js
list.description:
JWT token signing helper.

Note: The main application uses session cookies for auth; JWT is used only where explicitly required.

list.title: canUseNotifications
list.description: Whether the current runtime supports the Web Notifications API.

list.title: changePassword
list.description: Changes the current user's password.

list.title: cn
list.description: Tailwind-friendly className merge helper.

list.title: createCountry
list.description: Create a new country (super_admin).

list.title: createGalleryItem
list.description:
Creates a new gallery item (admin-only).

Expects multipart/form-data with:

  • image (file)
  • optional title and description

list.title: createLogEntry
list.description: Create a team log entry.

list.title: createNotification
list.description: Creates a notification.

list.title: createPost
list.description:
Creates a new post.

Accepts optional file upload (multipart/form-data) and stores the uploaded file URL in media_urls.

list.title: createRegistration
list.description:
Creates a registration.

Sets registration_date and forces status = 'pending'.

list.title: createSponsor
list.description: Creates a sponsor.

list.title: createStream
list.description: Creates a stream.

list.title: createTeam
list.description:
Create a new team (authenticated).

Enforces the single-team membership rule for the creator. Also creates the creator's TeamMembers record with role owner.

list.title: createTeamMember
list.description: Create a team member record.

list.title: createUser
list.description:
Creates a user.

Note: This handler is not currently exposed in the API router.

list.title: declineInvite
list.description:
Declines a team invitation by token.

If the invitation is bound to a specific user_id, the authenticated user must match.

list.title: decodeIfBase64
list.description:
Decodes a value if it appears to be base64.

Some clients may send credentials encoded; this keeps the API tolerant.

list.title: deleteCompetition
list.description: Delete a competition (super_admin only). Emits competition_deleted via Socket.IO.

list.title: deleteCountry
list.description: Delete a country by id (super_admin).

list.title: deleteGalleryItem
list.description: Deletes a gallery item and its stored file (admin-only).

list.title: deleteKey
list.description: Get key type, ttl, and value.

list.title: deleteLdapUser
list.description: Delete an LDAP user.

list.title: deleteLogEntry
list.description: Delete a team log entry.

list.title: deleteMedia
list.description: Delete a media record and its file on disk. Allowed for the uploader or a super_admin.

list.title: deleteNotification
list.description: Deletes a notification.

list.title: deleteOldLogs
list.description: Delete system logs older than N days.

list.title: deletePost
list.description: Deletes a post by id.

list.title: deleteRegistration
list.description: Deletes a registration by id.

list.title: deleteRobotFile
list.description: Delete a robot file. Requires team membership or admin.

list.title: deleteSelf
list.description: Deletes the current authenticated user.

list.title: deleteSponsor
list.description: Deletes a sponsor.

list.title: deleteStream
list.description: Deletes a stream by id.

list.title: deleteTeam
list.description: Delete a team by id (owner only via middleware).

list.title: deleteTeamMember
list.description: Delete a team member record by id.

list.title: deleteUser
list.description:
Deletes a user by numeric id.

Note: Ownership enforcement is performed in the router.

list.title: emitToUser
list.description:
Emits a realtime event to a specific user channel.

Client convention: listeners subscribe to events in the form ${eventName}:${userId}.

Additionally, when eventName === 'notification', this mirrors the event as a push notification (best-effort).

list.title: exportRegistrationsCSV
list.description: Exports registrations as a CSV.

list.title: forgotPassword
list.description:
Initiates a password reset using a one-time code.

This endpoint is designed to not reveal whether a user exists.

list.title: form
list.description: Render the create/edit form for a configured model.

list.title: frontend/src/hooks/useCountries.js
list.description:
Countries hook.

Fetches /api/countries and returns list + loading/error state.

list.title: frontend/src/hooks/useToast.js
list.description:
Toast state store + hook.

Implements a small in-memory toast store with subscribe/update/dismiss helpers.

list.title: frontend/src/lib/apiClient.js
list.description:
Frontend HTTP client utilities.

All API requests are routed through VITE_API_BASE_URL (configured in frontend/.env). The application uses cookie-based sessions, so requests are sent with credentials: 'include'.

list.title: frontend/src/lib/i18n.js
list.description:
Frontend i18n initialization.

Configures i18next + react-i18next, loads translation resources, detects and persists the selected language, and applies the lang attribute on the document root.

list.title: frontend/src/lib/notifications.js
list.description:
Web Notifications helper.

Provides small wrappers for checking browser support, requesting permission, and showing notifications.

list.title: frontend/src/lib/push.js
list.description:
Browser Push Notification helpers.

Registers the service worker and manages Web Push subscriptions. Uses the backend notification push endpoints under /api/notifications/push/*.

list.title: frontend/src/lib/utils.js
list.description: Utility helpers.

list.title: getApiOrigin
list.description:
Returns the backend origin (without the /api suffix).

This is primarily used for Socket.IO and for serving static assets.

list.title: getComments
list.description: Lists comments for a post.

list.title: getCompetitionById
list.description:
Get a competition by id.

If the requesting user is not approved (via an approved team registration), sensitive fields like stream_url are omitted.

list.title: getCompetitions
list.description: List competitions with optional filtering.

list.title: getCountries
list.description: List all countries.

list.title: getCountryById
list.description: Get a country by id.

list.title: getFileInfo
list.description:
Extracts normalized file info from a request after multer has run.

  • For upload.single, returns a single {@link UploadedFileInfo}.
  • For upload.fields, returns a record of arrays keyed by field name.
  • Returns null when no file data is present.

list.title: getIO
list.description: Returns the current Socket.IO server instance.

list.title: getKeyInfo
list.description:
List keys using SCAN.

Query params:

  • pattern (default *)
  • count (default 50, max 500)
  • cursor (default 0)

list.title: getMediaById
list.description: Get a single media record by id.

list.title: getMembershipStatus
list.description: Get the current user's membership/ownership status.

list.title: getMessages
list.description:
Get message history for a team.

Requires team membership (unless admin).

list.title: getMyTeam
list.description: Return the team the current user belongs to (or null).

list.title: getNotificationById
list.description: Retrieves a single notification by id.

list.title: getNotifications
list.description:
Lists notifications filtered by query params.

Supported query params:

  • user_id: filter by recipient
  • is_read: boolean
  • limit, offset: pagination

list.title: getOverview
list.description: Delete a key.

list.title: getPostById
list.description: Retrieves a single post by id (includes author, likes, and comments).

list.title: getPosts
list.description:
Lists posts.

Query params:

  • q: searches title/content
  • author_id: filters by author
  • limit, offset: pagination

list.title: getRegistrationById
list.description: Retrieves a registration by id.

list.title: getRegistrationStats
list.description: Return registration counts grouped by status.

list.title: getRegistrations
list.description:
Lists registrations.

Query params:

  • competition_id, team_id, status
  • limit, offset

list.title: getResendClient
list.description:
Lazily initializes and returns the shared Resend client.

If RESEND_API_KEY is not configured, returns null and email sending is disabled.

list.title: getRobotFiles
list.description:
List robot files.

  • When competition_id is provided without team_id, returns public files for that competition.
  • When both are provided, returns files for that team+competition.

list.title: getSelf
list.description: Returns the current authenticated user.

list.title: getSponsorById
list.description: Retrieves a sponsor by id.

list.title: getSponsors
list.description: Lists sponsors.

list.title: getStreamById
list.description: Retrieves a stream by id.

list.title: getStreams
list.description: Lists streams.

list.title: getSystemLogById
list.description: Get a single system log entry by id.

list.title: getSystemLogs
list.description:
Get system logs with filtering and pagination.

Supports filters: user_id, action, entity_type, entity_id, date_from, date_to.

list.title: getSystemStats
list.description:
Get aggregated system log statistics.

Returns action counts, entity-type counts, daily counts, and top users.

list.title: getTeamById
list.description: Get a team by id.

list.title: getTeamLogs
list.description: Get team log entries for a team and competition.

list.title: getTeamMemberById
list.description: Get a team member record by id.

list.title: getTeamMembers
list.description:
List team members.

Optional query filters: team_id, user_id.

list.title: getTeams
list.description: List teams with optional filtering.

list.title: getUserById
list.description: Retrieves a user by id.

list.title: getUsers
list.description:
Lists users.

Note: This handler is not currently exposed in the API router.

list.title: getUsersByRole
list.description: Return user counts grouped by role.

list.title: getUsersTimeline
list.description: Return user creation counts grouped by day.

list.title: getVapidPublicKey
list.description: Get the VAPID public key used by the browser to subscribe.

list.title: handleUploadErrors
list.description:
Express error handler for upload middleware.

Translates common Multer errors to consistent HTTP responses.

list.title: inviteToTeam
list.description:
Creates a team invitation.

The requester must be the team owner (enforced by requireOwnership('Team')). If the target user exists, a team_invite notification is created with a meta.invite_token so the invite can be accepted/declined from the UI.

list.title: leaveTeam
list.description: Leave the current team (non-owner only).

list.title: list
list.description: Render a list view for a configured model.

list.title: listFavoriteCompetitions
list.description: List the current user's favorite competitions.

list.title: listGallery
list.description: Lists gallery items (public).

list.title: listJoinRequests
list.description: List join requests for a team (owner only via middleware).

list.title: listKeys
list.description: Render the Redis explorer page.

list.title: listLdapUsers
list.description: Render the LDAP user list page.

list.title: login
list.description: Logs a user in by email/password and creates a session. Includes basic throttling/lockout via Redis.

list.title: logout
list.description: Destroys the current session.

list.title: me
list.description: Returns the current authenticated user session payload.

list.title: module.exports
list.description: Shared Sequelize instance used throughout the backend.

list.title: module.exports
list.description:
Ensures the request is authenticated via server-side session.

On success, populates req.user from req.session.user.

list.title: module.exports
list.description:
Adds a unique request id to each incoming request.

  • Sets req.id
  • Sets res.locals.requestId
  • Adds X-Request-Id response header

list.title: module.exports
list.description: Shared logger instance.

list.title: module.exports
list.description: Connected Redis client instance.

list.title: module.exports
list.description: Signs a JWT with a default 1-hour expiration.

list.title: module.exports
list.description:
Defines the Notification model.

Notifications are stored for a specific recipient user and can optionally carry a JSON meta payload for actionable notifications.

list.title: module:context/AuthContext
list.description:
Authentication session context provider.

The frontend uses cookie-based sessions. This provider keeps the current user in memory, refreshes /users/me on mount, and exposes helpers for login, register, logout, profile updates, and password changes.

list.title: module:context/AuthContext.AuthProvider
list.description: Authentication provider component. Wraps the application to provide authentication state and methods.

list.title: module:context/AuthContext.useAuthContext
list.description: Access the authentication context.

list.title: module:context/AuthContext~AuthContext
list.description: React context for authentication state.

list.title: module:context/SocketContext
list.description:
Socket.IO context provider for real-time communication.

Creates a single Socket.IO client pointing at the backend origin derived from VITE_API_BASE_URL and exposes { socket, connected } via React context.

list.title: module:context/SocketContext.SocketProvider
list.description: Socket.IO provider component. Manages a single Socket.IO connection for real-time features.

list.title: module:context/SocketContext.useSocket
list.description: Access the Socket.IO context.

list.title: module:context/SocketContext~SocketContext
list.description: React context for Socket.IO client.

list.title: module:hooks/useApi
list.description: Hook that returns the shared API request function.

list.title: module:hooks/useApi.useApi
list.description: Custom hook that returns a memoized function for making API calls. Uses the shared apiClient for consistent error handling and authentication.

list.title: module:hooks/useAuth
list.description: Convenience hook for accessing the AuthContext.

list.title: module:hooks/useAuth.useAuth
list.description: Custom hook providing access to authentication state and methods. Shortcut to useAuthContext().

list.title: module:hooks/useTeams
list.description: Teams API hook providing thin wrappers around /api/teams endpoints.

list.title: module:hooks/useTeams.useTeams
list.description: Custom hook providing team-related API methods. All methods are memoized with useCallback for performance.

list.title: module:models/Competition
list.description: Competition model definition for Sequelize ORM. Represents robotics competitions and events.

list.title: module:models/Competition
list.description: Defines the Competition model.

list.title: module:models/Competition~defineCompetitionsModel~Competition.associate
list.description:
Defines model associations.

  • Competition has many Streams.
  • Competition has many Registrations.

list.title: module:models/Team
list.description: Team model definition for Sequelize ORM. Represents robotics teams participating in competitions.

list.title: module:models/Team
list.description: Defines the Team model.

list.title: module:models/Team~defineTeamsModel~Team.associate
list.description:
Defines model associations.

  • Team has many Streams.

list.title: module:models/User
list.description: User model definition for Sequelize ORM. Represents registered users in the RobEurope platform.

list.title: module:models/User
list.description: Defines the User model.

list.title: module:models/User~defineUserModel~User.associate
list.description:
Defines model associations.

  • User has many Posts (as author).
  • User belongs to a Country.
  • User has many PostLikes.
  • User has many Comments (as author).

list.title: module:utils/push
list.description: Web Push notification utilities using VAPID protocol. Manages push subscriptions stored in Redis and sends notifications.

list.title: module:utils/push.getPublicKey
list.description: Returns the public VAPID key for client subscription.

list.title: module:utils/push.listSubscriptions
list.description: Lists all push subscriptions for a user.

list.title: module:utils/push.removeSubscription
list.description: Removes a push subscription for a user.

list.title: module:utils/push.saveSubscription
list.description: Saves a push subscription for a user. Stores in Redis Set to avoid duplicates.

list.title: module:utils/push.sendPushToUser
list.description: Sends a push notification to all subscriptions for a user. Automatically cleans up expired or invalid subscriptions.

list.title: module:utils/scheduler
list.description: Background scheduler for periodic tasks. Currently handles competition reminder notifications.

list.title: module:utils/scheduler.startSchedulers
list.description: Starts the background schedulers. Runs reminder check hourly and once at startup (after 15s delay). Safe to call multiple times - subsequent calls are no-ops.

list.title: module:utils/scheduler.stopSchedulers
list.description: Stops all background schedulers. Safe to call even if schedulers are not running.

list.title: module:utils/scheduler~REMINDER_WINDOW_HOURS
list.description: Time window in hours before competition start to send reminders.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger
list.description: System logging utility for audit trails and activity tracking. Captures user actions, IP addresses, and user agents for security monitoring.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger
list.description: Utility class for system-wide audit logging. Provides static methods for logging various types of system events.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.log
list.description: Creates a system log entry with optional request context. Extracts user ID, IP address, and user agent from the request object.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logAuth
list.description: Logs user authentication events (login, logout, password reset).

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logCreate
list.description: Logs entity creation events.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logDelete
list.description: Logs entity deletion events.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logSystem
list.description: Logs system-level events not associated with a specific user.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logUpdate
list.description: Logs entity update events with before/after values.

list.title: module:utils/systemLogger~SystemLogger.logUpload
list.description: Logs file upload events.

list.title: normalizeBase
list.description:
Normalizes a base URL into an API base ending with /api.

Examples:

  • http://localhost:85 -> http://localhost:85/api
  • http://localhost:85/api/ -> http://localhost:85/api

list.title: parseResponse
list.description: Parses a fetch Response into JSON (when possible) or plain text.

list.title: redirectIfAuthenticated
list.description: Redirects authenticated super admins away from the login page.

list.title: reducer
list.description: Reducer for toast actions.

list.title: register
list.description: Registers a new user and creates a session.

list.title: registerTeamInCompetition
list.description:
Register a team into a competition.

Creates a Registration row with status pending.

list.title: rejectRegistration
list.description: Rejects a pending registration.

list.title: remove
list.description: Delete a record for a configured model.

list.title: removeFavoriteCompetition
list.description: Remove a competition from the current user's favorites (Redis set).

list.title: renderAddLdapUser
list.description: Render the LDAP user creation form.

list.title: renderEditLdapUser
list.description: Render the LDAP user edit form for the given uid.

list.title: requestJoinTeam
list.description: Create a request to join a team.

list.title: requestNotificationPermission
list.description: Request notifications permission.

list.title: requireAdminSession
list.description:
Protects admin routes using session-based authentication.

  • Redirects unauthenticated users to /admin/login.
  • Enforces super_admin role.

list.title: requireOwnership
list.description:
Creates a middleware that ensures the authenticated user owns the record referenced by req.params.id.

Rules:

  • super_admin bypasses ownership checks.
  • Ownership is inferred from common column names:
    • created_by_user_id
    • author_id
  • For the User model, the record id is the owner.

list.title: requireRole
list.description:
Creates a middleware that enforces a specific role on req.user.

This project primarily uses user and super_admin roles.

list.title: resetPassword
list.description: Completes a password reset given a valid token.

list.title: resolveMediaUrl
list.description:
Resolves a backend-served media path to a fully qualified URL.

  • Absolute URLs are returned unchanged.
  • Relative paths are resolved against the API origin.

list.title: save
list.description: Create or update a record for a configured model.

list.title: searchUsers
list.description: Searches users by query string.

list.title: sendMessage
list.description:
Send a message to a team.

Accepts content and/or attachments. Attachments may be provided by the route upload middleware as req.files (array). Creates notifications for other team members and emits the message via Socket.IO.

list.title: sendPasswordResetCodeEmail
list.description: Sends a password reset email containing a one-time code.

list.title: sendTestPush
list.description: Send a test push notification to the authenticated user.

list.title: setIO
list.description: Sets the global Socket.IO server instance.

list.title: showNotification
list.description: Show a browser notification.

list.title: subscribePush
list.description: Save a push subscription for the authenticated user.

list.title: subscribeToPush
list.description:
Subscribe the current browser to push notifications.

Preconditions:

  • a valid ServiceWorker registration
  • secure context (HTTPS) unless localhost
  • Notifications permission granted

list.title: toggleFileVisibility
list.description: Toggle a robot file's public visibility. Requires team membership or admin.

list.title: toggleLike
list.description: Toggles the current user's like on a post.

list.title: togglePin
list.description: Toggles the pinned status of a post.

list.title: unsubscribeFromPush
list.description: Unsubscribe the current browser from push notifications.

list.title: unsubscribePush
list.description: Remove a push subscription for the authenticated user.

list.title: updateCompetition
list.description:
Update a competition (super_admin only).

When is_active is set true, this deactivates any other active competition. Emits competition_updated via Socket.IO.

list.title: updateCountry
list.description: Update a country by id (super_admin).

list.title: updateLdapUser
list.description:
Update an LDAP user.

Note: admin routes allow both POST /admin/ldap-users/edit/:uid and a fallback POST /admin/ldap-users/edit where uid is taken from the body.

list.title: updateNotification
list.description:
Updates a notification.

Common usage is to set { is_read: true }.

list.title: updatePost
list.description:
Updates a post by id.

Accepts optional file upload and enforces the content size limit.

list.title: updateRegistration
list.description: Updates a registration by id.

list.title: updateSelf
list.description:
Updates the current authenticated user.

Supports optional profile photo upload via multipart/form-data.

list.title: updateSponsor
list.description: Updates a sponsor.

list.title: updateStream
list.description: Updates a stream by id.

list.title: updateTeam
list.description:
Update a team by id (owner only via middleware).

Supports optional logo upload.

list.title: updateTeamMember
list.description: Update a team member record by id.

list.title: updateUser
list.description:
Updates a user by id.

Supports optional profile photo upload via multipart/form-data.

list.title: uploadMedia
list.description:
Upload a media file.

Uses multer to store the file under the server uploads/ directory and persists the record in the Media table.

list.title: uploadMiddleware
list.description:
Creates a multer middleware chain based on the given options.

Notes:

  • Defaults are inferred from the field name (e.g. video increases max size).
  • Always returns an array [multerMiddleware, handleUploadErrors].

list.title: uploadRobotFile
list.description:
Upload a robot file.

Requires membership in the given team (unless admin). The file is provided by route-level upload middleware and inspected via getFileInfo.

list.title: useToast
list.description: React hook exposing toast state and actions.

list.title: validatePasswordStrength
list.description: Validates password strength.
